titles.title: Vanishing Wildlife Stamp Act of 2000
To allow postal patrons to invest in vanishing wildlife protection programs through the voluntary purchase of specially issued postage stamps.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Service.

bill.summary: 7/18/2000--Introduced. Vanishing Wildlife Stamp Act of 2000 - Requires the Postal Service to establish a special rate of postage up to 25 percent higher than the regular rate to allow postal patrons to voluntarily purchase special postage stamps relating to vanishing wildlife protection programs.Requires amounts becoming available from public investment in such programs to be paid by the Postal Service to the Department of the Interior Multilateral Species Conservation Fund.
